start: ^I pulled up to Snow's Ice Cream Parlor.
^I loved Snow's ice cream. Everybody did.
^Everybody knew Nick Snow made the best ice cream in town.
^At least until he was found dead this morning.
^My job? To figure out who murdered him.
^I parked outside the front door and stepped out of the car.

c-0: ^Snow's was located on a quiet street downtown.
^The air was chilly, and the February streets were icy.
^A trashcan hang next to the large door.
c-1: ^The large double door leading inside Snow's Ice Cream Parlor had frosted glass, as if to hide the tragedy that had taken place inside.
^Yellow police tape marked "DO NOT CROSS" covered the door.
c-2: ^The trashcan contained an assortment of used plastic spoons.
c-3: ^I watched where I was putting my feet carefully.
^I didn't want to slip and fall here.
^I'm way too young to break a hip.
c-4: ^I pulled the doorknob, but the door was locked.
c-5: ^The door is locked. You don't have the key.

b: ^No need to knock anymore. I walked inside.

c-6: ^Soon, a young cop opened the door.
^"It's clo... Ah. You're Detective Addison Barsk?"
^"Good to see you. Please come inside."

b: ^As I entered the restaurant, a woman came in.
^"That would be great. Why don't you sit down? I'll be with you shortly."
^She sat down at a table and started scrolling social media on her phone.

options: ^TALK TO ASPEN|TALK TO CHEF|TALK TO WOMAN
^LOOK AT REGISTER|LOOK AT CASH REGISTER|USE REGISTER|USE CASH REGISTER
^LOOK AT NAPKIN|LOOK AT NAPKINS|LOOK AT NAPKIN HOLDER
^GO TO RESTROOM|GO TO TOILET|GO TO BATHROOM|GO TO RESTROOMS|GO TO TOILETS|GO TO BATHROOMS

c-0: ^The room I had entered was a large restaurant space.
^Chairs and tables were neatly placed everywhere.
^Against the back wall was a counter.
^I saw a door leading to the kitchen behind the counter.
^A sign above me pointed the way to the restrooms.
^In the back of the room, a stairway led to a door marked "PRIVATE".
c-1: ^Somebody must have cleaned them last night, after closing time.
c-2: ^I saw nothing irregular about the chairs.
^They looked expensive for an ice cream place.
^I guess that was to be expected here.
c-3: ^I don't have time to rest now.
c-6: ^The counter is empty except for a napkin holder and a cash register.
c-7: ^I pushed a button on the cash register, and the drawer popped out.
^So there was probably no burglary here.
^I closed up the cash register again.
c-8: ^The napkins of Snow's Ice Cream Parlor are pink and light green, with the restaurant's logo on them.

b: ^I grabbed a napkin and put it in my pocket.

c-10: ^The letters "WC" were printed on the sign hanging from the ceiling.
^It points towards a door in the back of the room.
c-11: ^The chef was a woman in her late thirties.
^She sat by a table, scrolling her phone.
c-14: ^I opened the door to the restroom and walked inside.
c-15: ^I climbed the stairs up to Snow's private apartment, and opened the door.

cop: ^"Morning, Detective. How can I help you?"
^"Anything related to the case. The victim. The weapon. The crime scene. The suspects."
^[Type BYE or LEAVE to finish conversation.]

c-0: ^"What do we know about the victim?"
^"Nick Snow. Age 41. Restaurant owner. Born and raised in town. Millionaire. Made really good ice cream."
^"His wife was Crystal Snow, 28. They lived together in the apartment upstairs. No known friends. His family all live in Finland."
c-1: ^"The freezer? Someone hit him with it?"
^"Nah. There's a big walk-in freezer in the kitchen. He was locked inside."
^"The key wasn't on him when he died. It was in his desk drawer."
^"The dishwasher. This morning. He'd been in there all night."
c-2: ^"The restaurant was locked up all night. No forced entry. So the perpetrator must have had a key."
^"Two people. A chef, and a dishwasher."
^"His wife Crystal is in the apartment upstairs. The dishwasher is in the kitchen. The chef is on her way."
c-3: ^"No problem. Just ask if you need anything else."

inv: ^LOOK AT PHOTO|LOOK AT PHOTOS|LOOK AT PHOTOGRAPH|LOOK AT PHOTOGRAPHS
^LOOK AT WATER|LOOK AT WATER BOTTLE|LOOK AT BOTTLE

c-1: ^The napkins of Snow's Ice Cream Parlor are pink and light green, with the restaurant's logo on them.
c-2: ^I was pretty sure there was absolutely nothing useful I could do with this napkin.
c-3: ^The photos show Crystal Snow, and a man I've never seen before, kissing intimately.
c-4: ^It was a bottle of vitamin water that tasted like cauliflower and kept cold in any temperature.
c-5: ^This water tasted like cauliflower. I was in no rush to drink it.
c-6: ^The bar of soap had the impression of the freezer key in it.
c-8: ^An exact replica of the key to the freezer, made from ice.

kitchen: ^TALK TO DISHWASHER|TALK TO DAN|TALK TO DANIEL|TALK TO MAN
^LOOK AT SHELF|LOOK AT SHELVES|LOOK AT SYRUPS
^LOOK AT DISHWASHER|LOOK AT MAN|LOOK AT DAN|LOOK AT DANIEL
^LOOK AT LIQUID|LOOK AT BOTTLE|LOOK AT WASHING UP LIQUID

c-0: ^The kitchen looked like any other restaurant kitchen.
^A large shelf was full of various syrups.

b: ^A young man was doing the dishes at a large sink.
^Dan wasn't here right now. This was my chance to examine that sink.

c-0: ^On the back wall a door led inside a big walk-in freezer.
c-2: ^No ice cream was being made here today.
c-3: ^I don't know what these things do.
c-4: ^It was stocked with eggs, cream and other ingredients.
c-5: ^The wall was covered with various ice cream syrups.
^It looked like they were made here.
^The labels had no names, only numbers.
c-6: ^I had no use for it, so I decided not to.

b:
^A young man washing dishes.

^What a strange thing to do at a crime scene.

^I guess the cop told him it was okay.
^He's not here right now. This is my chance to check out that soap.

c-8: ^A large sink, full of dishwater and dirty dishes.
^A tea towel, a bar of soap and a bottle of washing-up liquid are on the counter next to the sink.

b: ^I should pick it up to examine it closer.
^It looks like a regular bar of soap.
^I see no reason to pick up a bar of soap.

c-13: ^There was a large walk-in freezer in the back of the room.
^The door appeared to be lockable, but unlocked.

apartment: ^LOOK AT WIFE|LOOK AT WIDOW|LOOK AT CRYSTAL
^TALK TO WIFE|TALK TO WIDOW|TALK TO CRYSTAL

c-0: ^I had entered a small living room.
^The apartment was beautiful. Clearly, a lot of thought - and money - had gone into decorating it.
^A young woman - Snow's wife - sat on the sofa.
c-1: ^The sofa looks like a sofa that costs more than I make in six months.
^Sitting down on it is out of the question.
c-2: ^A woman in her late twenties, wearing a long, black dress, sat on the sofa.

dishwasher: ^"I'm the detective in charge. Can I ask you some questions?"
^"Sure. I'm Dan. What do you want to talk about?"
^I should probably ask him about last night.
^Finding out more about him would also be a good idea.

c-0: ^"Daniel Jones. I wash the dishes here."
^"Nick didn't like technology. 'My ice cream is ART,' he said, 'machines can't make ART!'"
^"Not a lot of spare time in this business."
c-1: ^"After we closed, I locked up the place. After doing that, I normally do the dishes."
^"Yeah... I didn't want to go to the kitchen last night."
^"Nick was yelling at Aspen. The chef."
^"Did you hear what they were yelling?"
^"He said her cooking was mediocre, and that she was lucky to have a job here. Then I think she threw a plate at him."
^"You're right. What did you do next?"
^"I went home. I figured I could return and do the rest of the dishes today. Which is how..."
^"I went straight to bed. But I talked to a neighbor when I got home."
c-2: ^"He was a cool guy. I mean, he hired me."
^"I was a high school dropout. Not a lot of people believed in me. He had faith in me. He gave me a job."
^"Letting you into his kitchen was the biggest compliment that guy could give anyone."
^"Yeah. I was good at it. Paid well, too."
^"I'm guessing you had no reason to kill him, then."
^"Honestly, I have no idea what to do now. I won't find another job like this."
^"Nick was the only one who knew his secret recipe."
c-3: ^"Wouldn't you normally do those last night?"

b: ^I should REALLY ask him about last night.

c-4: ^"Nah. Only Nick does. He leaves the key in the kitchen when we're open."
^"Was the freezer unlocked when you left last night?"

chef: ^I sat down next to the chef.
^I should probably ask her about last night, and what she knew about the victim.

b: ^ I should ask about that fight, and her resignation, too.

c-0: ^"I know of it. Were you alone?"
^"No. It was a friend's birthday party."
^"And what was Snow's state at that time?"
^"Was anyone else here when you left?"
^"I don't think so. Crystal was out, and Dan had already left."
^"So you may have been the last person to see the victim alive."
^"Well, I'm sure the last person to see him alive was the murderer."
c-1: ^"He's been my boss for eleven years."
^"I guess that's normal when you build a multi-million dollar ice cream empire."
^"Yeah, but nobody does that on their own. He's had a lot of help. And he's not the best at acknowledging that."
^"I don't think he appreciated how much I contributed here, no."
^"I had no problems working in the same kitchen as him. But he's not the kind of person I would have spent time with after work."
c-2: ^"I gave Nick my three month notice yesterday."
^Aspen pulled a bottle of water out of her bag and gave it to me. It felt cold.
^"It contains all the vitamins and calories you need in a day."
^"And its chemical balance keeps it cool and refreshing. Keep it in your bag for an hour on a hot summer day, and it's still like drinking ice water."
^"We have a wide range of flavors. Anything from raspberry milkshake to a full pot roast dinner. That bottle right there tastes like cauliflower."
^"That's what all our market research shows. My investor has twenty years of experience, and he's convinced it will be a hit. We're aiming for two hundred grocery stores by Christmas."

b: ^ So this is what she and Snow was fighting over last night. I should probably ask her about that.

c-3: ^"Were you and the victim fighting last night?"
^"I gave him my resignation. He didn't take it well."
^"I think he felt betrayed. 'I will not let you leave!' he shouted."
^"He believed there was a clause in my NDA that gave him the right to stop me from working in the food business for two years after quitting here."
^"Of course not. And I told him that."
^"He said 'You're not even that good a chef anyway!"
^"That's when you threw a plate at him?"

b: ^ I should probably ask what her new job is.

c-4: ^"It's not like I have a choice."
^She started scrolling on her phone again the second I got up from the table.

b: ^I jotted down what I'd just learned on my notepad.
^"Wait. You don't suspect me, do you?"
^"I've known him for eleven years! Just because I fought with Nick doesn't mean I killed him!"
^"Oh? You had a brilliant business idea that would make you rich, and he was in your way."
^"He couldn't stop me. My NDA didn't..."
^"But he could stall you in the courts for years."
^"And you were apparently the last person to see him alive."
^"Yeah, but compared to certain other people, that¨s a pretty weak motive."
^"I didn't want to tell you this. I figured it was none of your business. But I'm not going to jail protecting someone else."
^"I have some photos you should see."
^"I suggest you go in there, and... shake the mirror a bit. Okay?"

wife: ^I should probably ask her about the victim.
^It would be a good idea to ask for her alibi, too.

c-0: ^"What can you tell me about your husband?"
^"Yes. I moved in here last year. Two months before the wedding."
^"Yeah. We could afford to live anywhere, but Nick was primarily married to his job."
^"Eccentric, I guess. You know this was the first ice cream parlor to get a Michelin star?"
^"He was very... particular. Artists often are."
^"We had many friends. None of them very close."
^"Yes. Nick's biggest competitor. The two of them were always fighting over something or other. I doubt he could kill anyone, though."
^"He was. You think he was murdered for his money?"
^"I'm sure you already know I inherit everything he owns."
^"No need to beat around the bush, detective. I am aware I am a suspect here."
^"I will. That's certainly motive for murder. There's just two problems, though."
^"First, I was already rich before we met. As I'm sure my bank transcripts will show you, I had no need to murder anyone for money."
c-1: ^"Didn't you wonder why your husband never came to bed?"
^"I was visiting a friend. I spent the night there."
^"Nine this morning. The cops were already here by then."
c-2: ^I laid out the photos I'd found on the table in front of her.
^"Nick and I had an open relationship. I had boyfriends. He had girlfriends. I had girlfriends. He had boyfriends."
^"And he had no problem with that?"
^"When you're in the middle of a murder investigation, yes."
^"I can't blame you. That's why I didn't tell you straight away."
^"That he knew about and accepted my boyfriend."
^"I spoke to him on the phone last night. And I recorded the conversation."
^She grabbed her cellphone and pressed a few buttons. Soon, a man's voice rang out of its speakers.
^"Good! We just came to the hotel."
^"Say hi to Jack from me. What are your plans for the night?"
^The recording of Crystal's voice then continued to list off their plans for the night. I tried not to blush, and assume I failed spectacularly.
^"Nah, just tidying up a bit in the kitchen. Huh. That's odd..."
^"This bar of soap. It looks like someone has..."
^"Someone's coming. I have to go. See you tomorrow."
c-3: ^"Anything to help you find my husband's murderer."

freezer: ^USE NAPKIN WITH SOAP|USE SOAP WITH NAPKIN
^USE NAPKIN WITH WATER|USE WATER WITH NAPKIN
^USE WATER WITH SOAP|USE SOAP WITH WATER

c-0: ^Shelves along the walls were full of boxes of ice cream.
^I noticed a box on the top shelf that looked a bit different from the others, but I had no way of reaching it.
^On the floor I saw the tape outline of Snow's body.
c-1: ^The box on the top shelf looked a bit different from the others. It looked older, and at the same time more solid, as if it held something more... special than the rest. It looked like it still contained ice cream, though.
c-2: ^I had no way of reaching it.
c-3: ^This was where Nick Snow froze to death. No doubt about it.

b: ^Who could have done such a thing?
^I knew who the murderer was. Now I just had to catch him before freezing to death myself!
^The door was locked. I had to find a way to open it.

^The solid door to the freezer was lockable. That's what killed Nick Snow.

^Fortunately, it was open now.

c-6: ^Wrapping the soap won't get me out of here!
c-7: ^I soaked the napkin in water. It froze immediately.
^Before it froze to my fingers, I dropped it, and it shattered when it fell to the floor.
^That's right, Aspen said there was some chemical in this water that made it super cold.
c-8: ^I pulled out the soap, filled the outline with water from my water bottle, and it froze immediately.
^I now had a key made of ice. Hopefully, it would get me out of here.
c-9: ^I unlocked the door and rushed through the kitchen and into the restaurant.

climax: ^I picked up the soap and turned it in my hands.
^On the back of it was the outline of a key.
^Someone had used this soap to copy a key.
^And there was only one person that could have used this bar of soap undetected...
^I looked up, and saw Daniel Jones.
^I took a step back when I saw his knife.
^"After going home last night, you returned here around midnight, and used that copy to lock Nick Snow inside that freezer."
^"It's funny how everybody thinks of Nick Snow as this ice cream virtuoso. Sure, he invented his secret recipe twenty years ago, but he's not the one who's developed this place into what it is."
^"Every new flavor for the past five years? Her idea."
^"Nick was a good man, but a horrible businessman. Without Aspen's talent, this place would go bankrupt in a year."
^"Yeah. And that's when I got an interesting offer."
^"Do you know what's the one flavor of ice cream this place doesn't offer?"
^Because that's the base recipe that's used to make all the other flavors, and without any strong flavors to cover it, any ice cream manufacturer with a decent laboratory can easily recreate it."
^"And last week, I got an e-mail from the CEO of Frozen Empire, offering me half a million dollars for a small batch of vanilla ice cream."
^"Let me guess. There's a batch of it inside that freezer?"
^"The last remaining batch of the first portion Snow made."
^"I didn't mean to! I liked him.
^He probably wouldn't even discover it was gone.
^And then he had to walk in on me."
^I dove to the left, and he crashed past me and landed inside the freezer.
^"It's over now. Let's go down to the police station, and..."
^"No!" He pointed the knife at me.
^"Get inside the freezer. It may be too late for me to get away with that ice cream, but that doesn't mean I surrender."
^"Dan, please. You're only making things worse for yourself."
^He slammed the freezer door shut, and left the kitchen.
^I had to get out of here. Fast.
restroom: ^LOOK AT PHOTOS|LOOK AT PHOTO|LOOK AT PHOTOGRAPHS|LOOK AT PHOTOGRAPH

c-0: ^Each stall had a toilet in it.
^By the door, there were two sinks underneath a large mirror.
c-2: ^I caught my reflection in the mirror. I guess that means the mirror works.
c-3: ^The white sinks looked like they were great for washing your hands.
c-4: ^I quickly washed my hands, and turned the faucet off agin.
c-6: ^I reached out, touched the mirror, and shaked it a bit.
^From behind the mirror, two photographs suddenly fell to the floor.
c-7: ^I should probably pick them up first.
c-8: ^I picked up the photos from the floor and looked through them.
^The photos show Crystal Snow, and a man I've never seen before.
^They meet on the street outside the restaurant, and they kiss. Intimately.
^I was pretty sure this was not her husband.
^I had to talk to Crystal about this.

ending: ^"Are you okay?" The cop looked worried.
^"Huh? He left. He said you'd approved it!"
^I ran out the front door and looked around for him.
^A little bit further up the street,  I saw him running away on foot.
^My voice rang out before I realized I'd shouted it.
^The surprise of hearing my voice made him turn in shock. Only for a second, but that was enough.
^That was all it took for him to slip and fall on the icy February street.
^We quickly caught up with him, and the cop handcuffed him and read him his rights.
^"I told you you were only making things worse for yourself. Take him away."
^"No. It was inevitable. You tried to rise to the top with ice... And ice was what literally brought you down."
^"Thanks for finding his killer," a woman's voice said behind me.
^I turned, and saw that Crystal Snow had followed me here. "Just doing my job," I smiled.
^"We'll probably close down the ice cream parlor for good very soon. But until we do, you're welcome to eat as much ice cream as you want on the house."
^"Thanks. But after the past few hours...
^...I think I'd rather get myself a cup of hot chocolate."
